Validate and coerce any object as Dataschema

Source: R/04-harmo_process_harmonization.R
as_dataschema.Rd

Confirms that the input object is a valid Dataschema, and return it as a Dataschema with the appropriate mlstr_class attribute. This function mainly helps validate input within other functions of the package but could be used to check if a Dataschema is valid.

as_dataschema(object, as_mlstr_dataschema = FALSE)

Arguments

object

A potential Dataschema (list of tibble) to be coerced.

as_mlstr_dataschema

Whether the output Dataschema has a simple Dataschema structure or not (meaning has a Maelstrom Dataschema structure, compatible with Maelstrom ecosystem such as Opal environment). FALSE by default.

Value

A list of tibble(s), each of them identifying a Dataschema.

Details

The Dataschema must be a list of at least one or two data frame or data frame extension (e.g. a tibble) named 'Variables' and 'Categories' (if any), representing meta data of an associated harmonized study. The Dataschema is the core list of variables to be generate using study-specific variables. In addition, the Dataschema may follow Maelstrom research standards, and its content can be evaluated accordingly, such as naming convention restriction, columns like valueType' and 'label(:xx)', and/or any harmonization taxonomy provided.

Examples

{

# You can use our demonstration files to run examples
library(madshapR)

as_dataschema(DEMO_files$`dataschema - final`)
}
#> $Variables
